description: A World Government establishment known as the Judicial Island that hosted both CP9 headquarters and the courthouse for processing prisoners before they are sent to Impel Down. The island is unique for standing in eternal daylight and features a massive waterfall leading to a mysterious void beneath.
keyFeatures: Always stands in full daylight (never experiences night)
Massive waterfall under the island leading to a black void
One of three major Government strongholds triangulating the Tarai Current via the Gates of Justice
Connected to Water 7 by the Sea Train (Puffing Tom)
Impregnable fortress with multiple defensive layers

keyEvents.title: Arrival at Enies Lobby
keyEvents.description: CP9 arrives at Enies Lobby with Robin and Franky as prisoners, marking the first appearance of the Judicial Island in the anime.
keyEvents.significance: This arrival sets the stage for the Enies Lobby Arc, one of the most significant story arcs in One Piece.

statusHistory.description: Functioning as World Government judicial facility

reveals.information: Enies Lobby is known as the 'never-night island' that always stands in full daylight
Enies Lobby serves as the World Government's judicial island where prisoners are processed before being sent to Impel Down

description: The Sea Train connecting Water 7 to Enies Lobby, designed by the legendary shipwright Tom. In this episode, it serves as the location where Blueno battles Sanji and Sogeking while transporting Robin and Franky to Enies Lobby.

keyEvents.title: Battle on the Puffing Tom
keyEvents.description: Blueno uses his Devil Fruit powers and Rokushiki techniques to fight Sanji and Sogeking aboard the speeding Sea Train.
keyEvents.significance: The confined space of the train car and the danger of falling off creates intense battle conditions.

description: Another Sea Train prototype that cannot stop once it starts, being used by the Straw Hats and their allies to chase after CP9 and rescue Robin and Franky.

keyEvents.title: Yokozuna Joins on the Rocketman
keyEvents.description: Yokozuna the giant frog jumps onto the Rocketman, initially knocking it off the rails before joining the rescue mission.
keyEvents.significance: Yokozuna becomes part of the assault team heading to Enies Lobby.

description: Robin's homeland that was destroyed by a Buster Call twenty-two years ago. Appears in a brief flashback in this episode as Blueno reveals Robin's past.

keyEvents.title: First Glimpse of Ohara's Destruction
keyEvents.description: A brief flashback shows young Robin witnessing the Buster Call that destroyed her homeland Ohara.
keyEvents.significance: First visual appearance of Ohara in the anime, introducing the central trauma of Robin's backstory.

statusHistory.description: Destroyed by Buster Call 22 years before current timeline

reveals.information: Ohara was destroyed by a Buster Call when Robin was a child
